title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.13.43 | 21-10-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dhasya Gyananjini Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnu Padaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gaurabhani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatkyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gnadhara Shiva Sadhi Gaurabhakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramcheiva Narottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramcheiva Narottamam
In this session we will be discussing from the 43rd verse of the 13th chapter of the 1st
canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, Yatha Kredo Paskaraanam Samyoga Vigamavih Ichchaya Kreditu Syatam
Tathai Veshechaya Dranam.
The meaning of this verse is, as a player sets up and disperses his playthings according
to his own sweet will.
So the supreme will of the Lord brings men together and separates them.
These are words spoken by Narada Muni.
He is explaining to Yudhishthira when Yudhishthira questioned Narada Muni that I do not know
where my uncles have gone away.
You are like the captain of the ship.
So you please guide us to our destination.
So then Narada is.
First of all explaining the important principles by which this world is working and then he
will come to the actual facts about the uncles of Yudhishthira both Vidura and Dhritarashtra
as well as Gandhari, where have they gone.
That he will tell later but first of all he explains the general principles which is very
much helpful for all of us to understand the facts about our existence.
In this material world.
So in this verse, Narada is telling the supreme will of the Lord brings men together and separates
them both are due to the supreme will of the Lord.
But how does it actually work?
Some details are given by Srila Prabhupada in the purport.
We must know for certain.
That does not mean that we should not know.
That does not mean that we should not know.
We need to know that the particular position in which we are now setup is an arrangement
of the supreme will in terms of our own acts in the past.
So we have to consider the supreme will of the supreme Lord and also our own actions
in the past.
So.
It is.
So, it is not just the Lord alone who decides everything independently, there is also the
consideration of our own actions in the past.
What kind of actions?
Our material activities in the past.
We are held responsible for every action of ours, especially as human beings.
So this we should not forget.
If we don't act responsibly, we'll have to pay the price for irresponsibly acting because
we are under the laws of the Supreme Lord God.
These are called the laws of karma.
So every action we are accountable, whether the state laws may or may not consider the
consequence of every action of ours.
The state laws work within the framework of some constitutional laws for people who are
called citizens of this country.
But the laws of karma are not responsible for our actions.
The laws of God are working for every living being.
And especially the human being is held responsible for every action of his.
Srila Prabhupada further explains, the Supreme Lord is present as the localized Paramatma
in the heart of every living being, as it is said in the Bhagavad Gita in the 13th chapter
in the 23rd verse.
Upadrishta anumanam.
Svaramanta bharata bhoktamaheswaraha.
Paramatmeti capyukto dehesmin purushapparaah.
Krishna is explaining, there is another transcendental enjoyer in this body apart from the living
being who is a subordinate enjoyer, there is a transcendental enjoyer, he is called
Paramatma, the Super Soul.
Srila Prabhupada further explains.

cardinal

It's working. It's working in everybody's case. Neither rich man nor poor man has any control over such meetings or separations of living beings. The example of a player and his playthings should not be misunderstood.
Narad Muni is giving the example just like a player. He sets up different things. And according to his sweet will, he sets it up and he dismantles it. Whenever he likes, the way he likes.

So, this should not be misunderstood. How to understand this example properly? Srila Prabhupada says here, one may argue that since the Lord is bound to avoid the reactionary results of our own actions.
The example of a player.
player cannot be applied because earlier Prabhupada is mentioned according to our
reactions the Lord is giving us a certain placing us in a certain position
but we should not think that the Lord is completely bound up to reward each of
our reactions that is not true generally the Lord will give us our reactions
which is due to us but he may at his own will he may change
that also the karma memaamsa philosophy says that even if there is

of philosophers say we don't have to bother about God which is a wrong
philosophy while it is true that people in general get the reactions of their
own past actions according to the body they have got but still the Supreme
Lord always reserves the ultimate sanction of such reactions moment to
moment and in specific cases the Supreme Lord can change the reactions which are
due especially
proper explains that in the case of a a devotee who has surrendered to Krishna
so Shri la prabhupada explains how does it work in the case of a devotee we must
always remember that the Lord is a supreme bill and he is not bound by any

the law of karma is that one is awarded to the Lord itself when we are specific
about the duty of God who has made us that way we are bound up and we should
not get bound by any law generally the law of karma is that one is

the result of one's own actions but in special cases by the will of the Lord
such resultant actions are chained also so when is it changed this change can be

whatever he likes and because he is all perfect there is no mistake in any of
his actions or reactions the supreme law to the supreme perfect being therefore
there is no question of any mistake in any of his actions absolutely no
mistakes these changes of resultant actions are especially rendered by the
Lord
when a pure devotee is involved see when a pure devotee is involved the Lord is
particularly concerned about protecting the pure devotee in all circumstances in
all conditions even in this material world so the Lord is neutral as far as
non devotees are concerned according to the
divine law because the reactions are actually given to each living being who
is an art devotee but for a pure devotee the Lord intervenes according to his own

devotee who surrendered unto him without reservation from all sorts of reactions
of sins and there is no doubt about this so the Lord is able to change the

devotee so if he can change for a pure devotee then he himself is not bound by
any laws himself is not bound he is perfect and transcendent to all laws
